text: The ServerTokens Directive only affects HTTP headers, and not the footers that appear on Apache-generated pages, such as directory listings.  The only options that the ServerSignature Directive take, do not allow one to turn off the version number.  This is hard-coded into server/core.c, around this part here:  return apr_pstrcat(r->pool, prefix, "<address>" AP_SERVER_BASEVERSION " Server at ", ap_get_server_name(r), " Port ", sport,  It seems to me that hiding the version number of Apache, while still providing the useful header and e-mail address is important.  Any time there is a vulnerability or exploit found in a particular version of a web server, that is vital information to a cracker.  Anyhow, thank you for a great web server !  Good day,   - raven morris
creator: trisk@earthling.net

Personally, I think it is a silly idea.  But it is seems to be
a commonly requested feature to allow ServerTokens to flow through
to everywhere the server name is mentioned.
